turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: God! I've never seen anything like that in my whole life! Did you see that guy's nose?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Lynette, just keep your mouth shut until we get to the motel. Will you do that for me, please.

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: Well, excuse me for livin'!

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: What did you tell him about the baby?

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: That there isn't one, as of today. I had my period.  I couldn't believe it. He still wanted to marry me.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: And you turned him down??

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: Of course. I don't want no Okie from Muscogee. I can get that right here in Port Angeles.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: You little bitch! How could you? Was there ever a baby, Lynette? That's all I want to know! Did you make up that baby, Lynette? Did you??

turns.speaker: LYNETTE
turns.text: Of course there was a baby. I'd never lie about something like that. Would I, Paula?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Hey, what kind of name is Pokrifki?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Polish. What kind of name is Mayo?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Italian. My mom was Irish. I got her ears. But the rest is all wop.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Where are you from, Mayo the Wop?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Everywhere and nowhere, Paula the Polack.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Seriously.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: My father is a Rear Admiral in the Seventh Fleet.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Yeah. We've lived all over the world. Katmandu, Moscow, Nairobi.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Really? I've never been out of Washington except once when I visited this aunt of mine over to Portland. I mean, over at Portland. Ain't it pathetic the way folks talk around here?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: You got a girl?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: No, and I'm not looking for one either.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: I hear most of the girls who come to these things are looking for a husband.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Not me.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Yeah? Why're you here?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: To meet interesting people, improve myself. You wouldn't believe the losers we got over in Port Angeles.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Do you go to school?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: No. I work for National Paper. It's a good job. I make eight-twenty-three an hour.  When I get enough money saved, I plan to go on to college.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Think you'll make it all the way to getting your wings?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Who knows? Guys a lot smarter than me are dropping out like flies.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Just think 'I'm gonna do it!' Program yourself. See yourself making it. It'll happen. I know 'cause I just read this article in Cosmo, and it was about that very thing.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: You're a very pretty girl, Paula.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: I think we're making some of the locals jealous.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Who cares?  Mmmm. Now I remember. Mayo the Wop. Gee, I'm glad you're here. I've been looking forward to this all week.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Me, too.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: I vote for the motel.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: My kinda group!

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: I shouldn't have done that. I should've walked.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: He didn't give you much choice.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: There's always a choice.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Where'd you learn to fight like that?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: I don't feel like talking, if you don't mind.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Opening up just a little wouldn't kill you, ya know.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: You want me to fuck you? Is that it? Okay, come here. Take your clothes off. Get into bed.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Where's that coming from? I wouldn't fuck now if my life depended on it!

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Forget it. Just get out of here.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: I don't know who you think you're talking to! I ain't some whore you brought here! I've been trying to be your friend and you treat me like shit!

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Be a friend. Leave.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: You got no manners and you never tell the truth! You're nothin' special. And if you ask me, you got no chance at all of being an officer!

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: You stayed after all.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Wrong. I've driven a hundred and twenty miles, told a hundred and twenty lies, and said a hundred and twenty Hail Mary's since I saw you. Hungry?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: I'm starving.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Paula, I never try to fool anybody about who I am, what I want... so if even in the back of your --

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: I know who you are and what you want.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: What do you want, Paula? What do you really want?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: To have a good time with you until you have to go.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: That's it?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Zack, I dare you not to fall in love with me. I ain't gonna get serious with you, no way. But how can you resist me? I'm like candy.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: You're better than candy.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: I'm serious. It's gonna be hard to get enough.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Zack, when you're through with a girl, what do you do? Do you say something or do you just... disappear?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: I've never had a girl.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: I forgot to thank you for breakfast.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Any time, sailor.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: That was great.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: It sure was.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Want me to get a towel?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: I'll get it if you want.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: I don't want you to move.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: I don't want to move. But somebody has to move sometime. Eventually.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: They found them like that, shriveled up from weeks without food or water...

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: You know, sometimes I wish I was one of those girls they're letting in the flight program these days. God, I'd love to fly.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: What's stopping you?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: I don't care what the magazines say... it's just not as easy being a girl, especially from a Catholic family. You don't know the junk I grew up listening to, 'bout the way women are supposed to think and act.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: That's no excuse for not going after what you want.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Who says I'm not going after what I want? My mother's thirty-nine years old and she still works in that factory. Every time I see her, I know exactly what I don't want.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: My old lady swallowed a bottle of pills one day while I was at school.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: God.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: The thing that really got to me... she didn't leave a note. Nothing. I've always hated her for that.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Does it still hurt?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Naw. You're alone in this world no matter what kinda folks or background you had. Nothing hurts, pard, once you got that one down.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: I'm sorry. I can't sit with you.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: I understand. Maybe we'll see each other after the show...

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: What's the matter?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Nothing. Go back to the show, Paula.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: I've seen all that a hundred times.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Hey, will you just leave me alone?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Come on. Invite me. All day the idea of a family Sunday dinner's been coming into my head. Since you're the only one I know around here with family...

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Zack, I don't know if I want to do that...

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Hey, what about Sunday dinner? When're you gonna let me know?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: When I'm good and ready.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Are those for me?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: No, they're for your mom.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: I'm so embarrassed. I knew I shouldn't have brought you here.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: No, it's okay. It was a great free meal. Everybody was so uptight I felt sorry for you.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: That's okay. I'm used to it.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: So, after you graduate you go on to basic flight, right? Is that in Pensacola?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Yeah, then if I get jets, it's on to Beeville, Texas.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Zack, do you ever think about what it'd be like to have kids... a family.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: No. Is that what you want?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Some day. When I'm sure I can do a better job of it than my folks.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: What would you do differently?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: For a start, I wouldn't marry a man I wasn't in love with.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Why'd your mom marry that guy if she didn't love him?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Because my real father wouldn't marry her.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Your real father?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Your real father was an Officer candidate like me?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Twenty-two years ago.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: No wonder he was looking at me like that.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Call me during the week if you get the chance.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: I'll try, but this week we go into survival training, so I can't make any promises.  Well, thanks again for dinner. Thank your mom again for me, will you?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Sure.  Zack, I hope you know I didn't have to show you that picture.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: I know that.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: I'm looking for Sid.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Paula, he DORed and nobody's seen him.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Why'd he do it?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Hey! You know goddamn well what happened so let's not play any games, okay?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: I'm not playing any games! Go look at Lynette's!

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: I don't know where that is.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: I'd like to come with you.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Because he's my friend, too.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Please stop it. None of that's true. Goddamnit, I love you. I loved you ever since I met you.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Come on, Paula! You were looking for a ticket out of here and you didn't care who it was, any more than you cared with the last class of candidates you and Lynette fucked your way through, looking for a husband! Or the class before that!

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Yeah. You got the whole story just right.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Beware of the Puget Debs -- and we all laughed, especially him.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: I'm not a Puget Deb. I hate that goddamn term!

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: I bet you do!

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: However you got it figured, I didn't kill Sid and Lynette didn't kill him! He killed himself!

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: That's brilliant.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Maybe not, but it is the truth. And Zack, you didn't kill him either.

turns.speaker: PERRYMAN
turns.text: How do you figure that's your bunk?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: He said it's up to us and I got here first, didn't I?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Two bucks a buckle, Perryman. Look at that shine! Boonies'll cost you five.

turns.speaker: PERRYMAN
turns.text: Who's got two bucks? It's costing me every penny they pay us just to keep my old Lady and my kids in that motel.

turns.speaker: PERRYMAN
turns.text: Hey, man, is the piss-ass money you're making off this worth the risk of getting us all kicked out of here on an honor violation?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: I don't notice anyone else complaining.

turns.speaker: PERRYMAN
turns.text: I'll never get it polished in time. Give me a buckle, Zack.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: I can't risk it.

turns.speaker: PERRYMAN
turns.text: You'd make it. He's just getting to the girls. Come on, Zack. I gotta see my family, man. I couldn't take it if he keeps me here over the weekend.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Sorry, pard. Wouldn't want you to get an honor violation.

turns.speaker: PERRYMAN
turns.text: I see you didn't DOR, Mayo.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Hey, Sid, thanks.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Hey, do you guys ever... feel like you don't belong here...?

turns.speaker: PERRYMAN
turns.text: Yeah. All week long.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: How about that prick! He told me he wasn't officer material because he grew up poor like me.

turns.speaker: PERRYMAN
turns.text: He said he grew up poor?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: The kid on the windy side of the baker's window. That's how he put it.

turns.speaker: PERRYMAN
turns.text: Foley's not poor. Buddy of mine in oh-four told me he's the son of a rich doctor down in Louisiana.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: That Foley looks like he's been through a war or two.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: I've seen better.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Think there's any truth to what he was saying about those girls? Is that still going on?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Sure it is, Sweet Pea, but he should've warned you 'scuzzy' female types about the 'Puget Dudes.' They'll tell you they're wearing a rubber but they've bit a little hole in the end.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Jets.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: I hate to tell you guys, but only two out of every class make it into jets. Which one of you is going with me?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Hey, you gonna tell anybody about this?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Not if you make it worth my while. How about free boonies for the duration?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: You told us it would grow out an inch.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: It's grown out more than an inch, sweetheart.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Could you believe those girls!

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: 'Nellie's Nymphos!'

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Jesus, that Lynette! I rode her hard and put her up wet.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Look at Foley! Can you believe it!

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Shhhh...

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Nice, hospitable folks they get around here.  I hope she comes.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: She'll come, pard. A rich socialite Oakie like you oughta be a big catch around these parts.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Get off my case, Mayo. I didn't grow up rich.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Hey, you guys still awake?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: What's the matter, Sweet Pea. Foley finally starting to get to you?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Naw.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: That isn't true, is it?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: A little.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: I kid you not, Mayo, I am in love. We must've set a new indoor record today. You want to know how many times we did it?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: You'd better get smart, man. It's time to walk away.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: What? You've gotta be kidding!

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Remember what Foley said? His little warning? Those are the girls he was talking about. They're out to marry us any way they can.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: I don't believe that. They're just having a good time, same as us.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: That's what they want you to think, but I saw where she lived, what is she's trying to get away from.  Just take my word for it, pard. Break it off now. Do it this week.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Thanks for covering for me.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: No problem, but who's Susan?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: My girl back home. We're supposed to get married after I get my wings. She was Tommy's girl. They were engaged to be married before he died.  I should've told you about her. I don't know why I didn't, except I didn't want you to think I was a shit for making it with Lynette.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: I'm not your folks, man. You love this... Susan?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: She's the sweetest person I've ever known. Loves kids. Works with handicapped kids every afternoon at the church. Everybody loves her.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: I didn't ask you all that, Sweet Pea. I asked if you loved her.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Listen, I'm not going to go to that little reunion party. I'm meeting Lynette at the motel.  Best head in fifty-two states. After three days of survival training, how could I resist?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: You should've done what I did. A clean break.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Lynette told me it really tore her up when you didn't call this week.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Talk to me in the morning. I feel like shit.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: But it can't wait.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Calm down, Sweet Pea. She seen a doctor?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: No, but she's gotta be at least a month late.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Doesn't mean shit. Get her to a doctor. You can't do anything until you hear what he says. Make the appointment yourself.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: It's a big religious thing with her and she won't even discuss it.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: But she expects you to marry her?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: She said it was up to me. If I don't, she'll go off and have the baby on her own somewhere.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: So what's the problem? Girls do that all the time.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: I can't let her go off and have the kid by herself and not do anything. If it's my kid, too, then I've got a responsibility, don't I?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Not if she won't even talk about an abortion.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: But it would still be my kid. That's the point.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Do you know that for sure?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: It's mine.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Okay, but what if it's like Foley said and she got knocked up, to trap you -- is it still your responsibility?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: No matter how it happened, if she goes ahead and has it" Zack, there'll be a child in the world that's mine -- and I couldn't go through life knowing that and not knowing its name or where it lived.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Jesus Christ, Sid! Is everything your responsibility?

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Sid, what happened?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: I don't know... I felt like... like I was suffocating... Christ, Zack... I was so scared... so godddamn scared...

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: He's right, Zack. It doesn't matter.

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: Just like that it's all over? With less than two weeks to go, you're out?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Please, Zack -- go back to the barracks!

turns.speaker: ZACK
turns.text: I don't get it! He's the best candidate in our class! Ask anyone! The best student! The best leader! The best friend to everybody! Couldn't you bend your goddamn standards just a little?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Zack, it wasn't him! He didn't ask me to D.O.R. I came to him on my own.  I'm glad it's over, Zack. I really mean that. He was right. I wasn't doing this for me.

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: A woman and a little girl, both asleep upstairs.

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: You're fuckin' A we can do this.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Not with me.  Not with people.

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: No problem.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: I don't want Raoul to administrate that part.

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: You're welcome.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Peace out.

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: What if she called the cops?

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: She didn't.

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: What the fuck is funny about this?

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: God.

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: There is not one thing funny here.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Who else but God could think this shit up?  I spend ten years building those fucking rooms to keep people out, now I gotta figure out how to get in.  God, man, He just loves the irony.

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: So what the fuck are we supposed to do?!

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Make her come out.  And when she does, that's when we gotta be careful.  She can't get out of this house.  She can't even think she can get out of this house.  We just keep them here and keep them quiet for forty-five minutes.  And I don't want  Joe Pesci here standing over them with his fat sweaty finger on the trigger.  That's a sure way for us to end up with two dead bodies and little puffs of smoke burning out of our heads up in Greenhaven.  So we're gonna seal the place up.  They wanna hole up in here?  Fine, we'll help 'em.  Make it impossible for them to leave.  Once they come out of that room.

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: He said open it.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Just sending a message.  She'll get the point.

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: You should see the look on your face.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: The fuck did you do that for?!

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: Fuckin' asshole, thinks he knows me. Drives his German car up to 125th Street a couple of times, buys a few rounds, thinks he's a tough guy, thinks he knows me.  You don't know one thing about me!

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Stop it!  Stop it!

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: Who's the clown now?  Huh?!  Who's the fucking clown now?!

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Me.  I am.

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Burning me.  It's burning my eye.

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: I have the gun.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: Remember that.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Please...

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: What?  What do you want me to do?

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: What do you think?  Get us into that room.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: I can't.

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: You can.  You're full of ideas.  You just need to squeeze one out.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: I can't...

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: You got till the count of three. Then you end up like him.

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: One.  Squeeze.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: This is ridiculous...

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: Two.  Squeeze harder.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: I can't just...

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: Th --

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Okay, okay!  Okay.

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: You got an idea?

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Yeah.  Yeah, I got an idea.  I gotta check something.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Are you okay?

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: Hurry up, for Christ's sake!

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: The hell does she want?

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: I don't know, she keeps screamin' the same thing over and over.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Yeah, just like a half hour, maybe a little more, and your mom'll give it to you.  You can wait a half hour, can't you?

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: Yeah.  She can.  She's fine, she's just like, tired, she's gotta rest. You rest, Kid.  Half an hour.

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: You're wasting your fucking time, man, you're wasting my time.  You don't know how to do this, and the longer we stay in here, the more likely she's gonna lose it and call the cops!

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Are you gonna open the safe?

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: She's fuckin' crazy, she killed the kid!  She just killed her own kid!

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: It's not her fault, it's not her fault, the guy must have called them.  Look, look, look, she's telling us.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: She's gonna handle it.

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: She better.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: That's your problem.

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: That's their problem.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Let me fucking finish this so we can get out of here.

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: You finish.  Then we finish.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: -- posed to mean?

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: You're here with me, you're already on the hook for one.  Buy one, you get the rest for the same price. You know that.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Get the fuck away from me.

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: The kid in here.  The other two when we come out.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Bullshit.

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: You know how this gotta end.

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: The walls are steel, right?

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Not that one.

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: NOT THAT ONE?!

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Hey man, it's the neighbor's house, who breaks in through the neighbor's house?!

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: WHO THE FUCK BREAKS IN THROUGH THE NEIGHBOR'S HOUSE?!

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: We've got the Kid!  WE'VE GOT YOUR KID!!  What the fuck is she thinking?!

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: She's got your gun, that's what she's thinking!  The FUCK you had to bring a gun for?!

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: YOU KNOW HOW THIS IS GONNA GO!

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: FUCK YOU, I'M GONE!

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Fuck.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Fuck!

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Keep your voice down.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: They're not supposed to be here!

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: This was your department, Junior.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: They're not supposed to be here!

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: That's why the key didn't work, they changed the locks.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Fourteen day escrow, man, that's almost three weeks!  They shouldn't be here for another week!  They don't own this house yet!

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Exactly how is fourteen days almost three weeks?

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Fourteen business days.  Escrow is always business days.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: I mean, right?  Isn't it?

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: You're an idiot.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Who is this guy?

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Raoul is cool.  That's all you need to know.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: This is insane.  I'm outta here.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Unless Daddy comes back later.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Daddy's not coming back, she's in the middle of a divorce, it's just the two of them.  We're okay, here.  We can do this, right?

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Forty-five minutes.  That's all you said you need.  That's like nothing.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: She'll call the cops, they'll be here before I get unpacked.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: So we keep an eye on her.  Raoul can totally administrate that part.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: They won't get hurt.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: What about us?  What if she has a gun?

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Raoul, what in God's name do we do if she has a gun?

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Asshole.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: A guy shows you a gun, Burnham, and you insult him?  Hey, who's the idiot?  Huh?

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: Where did you get this clown?

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: I met him at the tables, same as you.  And frankly, I'm grateful we have a little muscle right about now.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: What tables?  I've never seen him before.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Different tables.

turns.speaker: BURNHAM
turns.text: The fuck did you bring a gun for?
